intro: Chrysanthemum koraiense, commonly known as the Korean chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features finely divided, feathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its significance in horticulture and traditional medicine.
